intro: Gyminda latifolia subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf gyminda, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in well-drained soils in open woodland or heathland environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
